title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to Plural Handle of the Data Objects from System & Settings.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44765
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---Associations
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11746
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11746/commits/0f0564232e0a49719d0bdff6223539b624f116ee
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11746/commits/92bcc208078571f4beda38cb0952f8e99887737a
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6xx7-r8x4-fpjp
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.2 is vulnerable to possible Auth bypass in the jobs section.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28473
  • https://concretecms.com
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11749
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/tag/8.5.13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pj76-75cm-3552
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) is vulnerable to possible auth bypass in the jobs section

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.2 does not have Secure and HTTP only attributes set for ccmPoll cookies.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28472
  • https://concretecms.com
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11749
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/tag/8.5.13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f55r-8rcv-mqcf
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS missing secure cookie parameters

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.1 is vulnerable to Stored XSS in uploaded file and folder names.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28819
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11749
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/tag/8.5.13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-474f-mcjv-pgrm
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) is vulnerable to stored XSS in uploaded file and folder names

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS on the Reply form because msgID was not sanitized.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28475
  • https://concretecms.com
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/commit/861ba66d248165c9ee9d6d11a0457908b97d68f0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vcpr-hm2m-gjjj
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Reflected cross site scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Concrete CMS v.9.2.1 allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Forms of the Data objects.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44761
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Stored-XSS---Forms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p4jj-gwpg-9jwh
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS before 8.5.13 and 9.x before 9.2.2 allows stored XSS on the Admin page via an uploaded file name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48649
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11695
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11739
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8513-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/922-release-notes
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/2023-11-09-security-blog-about-updated-cves-and-new-release
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36fr-3wg8-q5v8
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS before 8.5.13 and 9.x before 9.2.2 allows stored XSS on the Admin page via an uploaded file name.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48649
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11695
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11739
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8513-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/922-release-notes
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/2023-11-09-security-blog-about-updated-cves-and-new-release

items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS before 8.5.13 and 9.x before 9.2.2 allows unauthorized access because directories can be created with insecure permissions. File creation functions (such as the Mkdir() function) gives universal access (0777) to created folders by default. Excessive permissions can be granted when creating a directory with permissions greater than 0755 or when the permissions argument is not specified.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48648
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8513-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/922-release-notes
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/2023-11-09-security-blog-about-updated-cves-and-new-release
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/11677
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/commit/707b974826b761dda5c0baaf345c8582157d9307
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/commit/eb882681a0ed19798a8f689d257af8dfe2f3a279
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m87h-jxr6-f82w
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS allows unauthorized access because directories can be created with insecure permissions

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS before 8.5.13 and 9.x before 9.2.2 allows unauthorized access because directories can be created with insecure permissions. File creation functions (such as the Mkdir() function) gives universal access (0777) to created folders by default. Excessive permissions can be granted when creating a directory with permissions greater than 0755 or when the permissions argument is not specified.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-48648
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8513-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/922-release-notes

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m87h-jxr6-f82w
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS allows unauthorized access because directories can be created with insecure permissions

items.content_html:
In a shared hosting environment that has been misconfigured to allow access to other users' content, a Moodle user who also has direct access to the web server outside of the Moodle webroot could utilise a local file include to achieve remote code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5550
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2243452
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451591
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-72249
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/77766f9c8af8fc8d861d7ac09ce4e1f6e72faca7
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5cvx-cwpx-9rjh
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Code Injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
Separate Groups mode restrictions were not honoured in the forum summary report, which would display users from other groups.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5551
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2243453
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=451592
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-79310
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/2bb6c551cf2e7be29857db35388911b8179394b0
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/6de45d2c9f7dd7b24210ab0310c296366a82986a
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/b91feb0b2328cdda2561d68b8dfe2a129190bc85
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jr83-8x65-xcr5
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability
